com.xith3d.render
Class Renderer

java.lang.Object
  com.xith3d.render.Renderer
public class Renderer
extends Object

The renderer is the main class for managing the transformation from the scene graph to the 3d card. The renderer is in charge of atom shader sorting, transparency passes, etc.

The actual opengl/directx calls are made by the rendering peer which is supplied when the renderer is created. The renderer supports several different modes of operation including offscreen, render to texture, render to image and rendering to screen.

Copyright (c) 2003 David Yazel Copyright (c) 2003

Constructor Detail

Renderer

public Renderer()
Creates a new renderer with the specified RenderPeer. This could be a LWJGL peer, JOGL peer, etc.

buildRenderFrame

startFrame

public void startFrame()
tells the render engine that we are starting a new frame. All render buffers are cleared to prepare to receive new atoms for rendering.

addAtom

public void addAtom(RenderAtom atom)
Adds an atom to be rendered. The atoms are sorted into multiple render bins to facilitate multiple passes where necessary.

getDefaultPriorities

public static StatePriorities getDefaultPriorities()
Sets the sort order for all shader states. The lower states will be the primary sort keys and the priority drops further into array of state priorities. So if you want geometry states to have highest priority put them early in the list, while material priorties might be further down.
